Name: Acceptance Criteria - SMWS to be written for each activity on Project and shall be reviewed by a competent person.
Submitted to the client
Resource Id: days prior to commencement of Activity.

Name: Acceptance Criteria - No work shall commence unless all erosion/ Sediment controls are implemented in accordance with EMP.
Acceptance Criteria - DBYD information available on site, Excavation permit issued and spotter at location before commencement of excavation works
Acceptance Criteria - All Earthworks shall be finished to conform to the levels, lines, grades and cross sections showed in the plans.
Acceptance Criteria - Material classified as silt, either before or after compaction, is not acceptable as Type C material unless otherwise approved by the Superintendent.

Acceptance Criteria - Prior to commencing excavation in any area and during excavation work, the Superintendent and the Contractor shall inspect each type of material encountered and subject to verification by appropriate laboratory testing, agree on the category of the material in accordance with Clause 204.04.

Acceptance Criteria - Where groundwater or seepage is encountered the Contractor shall notify the Superintendent and submit the proposed action to be taken to the Superintendent for review. The Contractor shall submit any necessary approvals from relevant authorities for the treatment and disposal of this groundwater.
Acceptance Criteria - Where unsuitable material is encountered the Contractor shall submit the proposed in situ treatment or extent of excavation to the Superintendent for review.
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor shall not commence placing of any fill on the prepared surface until the area has been reviewed by the Superintendent.
Earthworks - Fill at Structures (wing walls, culverts >1200mm)
Acceptance Criteria - No fill shall be placed against or within 3m of a structure until the foundation for the fill has been reviewed by the Superintendent.
Acceptance Criteria - Undertake test roll prior to placement of fill/or proceeding layer.
Acceptance Criteria - Type C: 10,000m2 or one day's production, whichever is the lesser
○ All Type C material should conform to 95% of a standard density
Acceptance Criteria - SMWS to be written for each activity on Project and shall be reviewed by a competent person.
Submitted to the client
Resource Id: days prior to commencement of Activity.

Name: Acceptance Criteria - No work shall commence unless all erosion/ Sediment controls are implemented in accordance with EMP.
Acceptance Criteria - DBYD information available on site, Excavation permit issued and spotter at location before commencement of excavation works
Manufacture Precast Documentation (QMP, ITPs,ITCs, Shop Drawings, Reports)
Acceptance Criteria - Delivery Docket for each Pit must be clearly identified and uploaded to the lot
Acceptance Criteria - Pit Unit Identification must be visible after installation for further identification
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete - Shall be N32 standard strength grade?
○ Covers, Lids, Grates, Lintels as shown on drawings
○ Step Irons - Those manufactured from 13mm steel bar covered with polypropylene plastic must be approved by superintendent
Acceptance Criteria - Clearance from all external faces of the pit to each face of the excavation shall be not less than 400mm.
○ Bedding shall be supplied, placed and compacted to a thickness not less than 80mm on a clay foundation or 150mm on a rock foundation.
Acceptance Criteria - Holes for subsurface drains should be 150mm unless specified otherwise.
○ Weepholes of 50mm shall be provided in all precast pits (see spec for location)
○ Segmented pits require a minimum 15mm rebate.
Acceptance Criteria - All stormwater drainage connections to pits shall be neatly made, and where necessary the ends of all drains shall be trimmed off and finished with cement mortar.
Acceptance Criteria - Pits greater than 1.0m deep shall be fitted with step irons. Step irons of an approved proprietary type shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions.
Acceptance Criteria - Pit floors shall be smoothly shaped from the inlet to the outlet for a height of 1/3 of the diameter of the outlet pipe.
Acceptance Criteria - Frames for pit covers shall be cast into the top of the pit or bedded on fresh mortar, 5mm thick, consisting of 2 parts sand : 1 part cement and sufficient water.
○ Level at every point of the perimeter shall be within 10mm of the design level for that point, and the line of the cover shall be within 10mm of the design kerb line.
Acceptance Criteria - Backfilling around pits shall be placed in layers not exceeding 300mm loose thickness and compacted to refusal using hand held mechanical equipment.
Acceptance Criteria - SMWS to be written for each activity on Project and shall be reviewed by a competent person.
Submitted to the client
Resource Id: days prior to commencement of Activity.

Name: Acceptance Criteria - No work shall commence unless all erosion/ Sediment controls are implemented in accordance with EMP.
Acceptance Criteria - DBYD information available on site, Excavation permit issued and spotter at location befotre commencement of excavation works
Acceptance Criteria - All Earthworks shall be finished to conform to the levels, lines, grades and cross sections showed in the plans.
Acceptance Criteria - Material classified as silt, either before or after compaction, is not acceptable as Type A material unless otherwise approved by the Superintendent.

Acceptance Criteria - The level at any point on the surface of the Cut Floor Level immediately below capping and/or selected material shall not differ by more than 15 mm above or 30 mm below the specified level.

Acceptance Criteria - Prior to commencing excavation in any area and during excavation work, the Superintendent and the Contractor shall inspect each type of material encountered and subject to verification by appropriate laboratory testing, agree on the category of the material in accordance with Clause 204.04.
Earthworks - treatment of cutting at cut floor level

Acceptance Criteria - In situ material below cut floor level having an assigned CBR less than 6, or a swell of 2.5% or greater, shall be removed to a depth of 400mm below cut floor level and replaced with conforming type B material to the underside of the capping or selected material layer

Acceptance Criteria - Where groundwater or seepage is encountered the Contractor shall notify the Superintendent and submit the proposed action to be taken to the Superintendent for review. The Contractor shall submit any necessary approvals from relevant authorities for the treatment and disposal of this groundwater.
Acceptance Criteria - Where unsuitable material is encountered the Contractor shall submit the proposed in situ treatment or extent of excavation to the Superintendent for review.
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor shall not commence placing of any fill on the prepared surface until the area has been reviewed by the Superintendent.
Earthworks - Fill at Structures (wing walls, culverts >1200mm)
Acceptance Criteria - No fill shall be placed against or within 3m of a structure until the foundation for the fill has been reviewed by the Superintendent.
Acceptance Criteria - Undertake test roll prior to placement of fill/or proceeding layer. Contractor shall provide for the Superintendant to be present during all test rolling.
Acceptance Criteria - Type A: max 5000m2 or one day's production, whichever is the lesser
○ All Type A Material, and Type B material placed within 400mm of top of cut floor level: min. 100%
Frequency - 1 test for each lot then reduced to 1 test for every second lot
Acceptance Criteria - Type A: initial 1 lot test to determine assigned CBR >6% and swell <1.5%
Frequency - Single CBR test to confrim assigned CBR and swell - first lot only
Acceptance Criteria - Type A: plasticity index (PI) calculation x % Passing 0.425mm, Max. 1000
Frequency - 1 test per 2 lots then 1 test per 4 lots
Acceptance Criteria - Type A: liquid limit and comparison of PI against LL, Permeability <5 x 10-9m/sec
Frequency - 1 test per 2 lots then 1 test per 4 lots
Acceptance Criteria - SMWS to be written for each activity on Project and shall be reviewed by a competent person.
Submitted to the client
Resource Id: days prior to commencement of Activity.

Name: Acceptance Criteria - No work shall commence unless all erosion/ Sediment controls are implemented in accordance with EMP.
Acceptance Criteria - DBYD information available on site, Excavation permit issued and spotter at location before commencement of excavation works
Acceptance Criteria - All Earthworks shall be finished to conform to the levels, lines, grades and cross sections showed in the plans.
Acceptance Criteria - Material classified as silt, either before or after compaction, is not acceptable as Type B material unless otherwise approved by the Superintendent.

Acceptance Criteria - The level at any point on the surface of the Cut Floor Level immediately below capping and/or selected material shall not differ by more than 15 mm above or 30 mm below the specified level.

Acceptance Criteria - Prior to commencing excavation in any area and during excavation work, the Superintendent and the Contractor shall inspect each type of material encountered and subject to verification by appropriate laboratory testing, agree on the category of the material in accordance with Clause 204.04.

Acceptance Criteria - Where groundwater or seepage is encountered the Contractor shall notify the Superintendent and submit the proposed action to be taken to the Superintendent for review. The Contractor shall submit any necessary approvals from relevant authorities for the treatment and disposal of this groundwater.
Acceptance Criteria - Where unsuitable material is encountered the Contractor shall submit the proposed in situ treatment or extent of excavation to the Superintendent for review.
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor shall not commence placing of any fill on the prepared surface until the area has been reviewed by the Superintendent.
Earthworks - Fill at Structures (wing walls, culverts >1200mm)
Acceptance Criteria - No fill shall be placed against or within 3m of a structure until the foundation for the fill has been reviewed by the Superintendent.
Acceptance Criteria - Undertake test roll prior to placement of fill/or proceeding layer.
Acceptance Criteria - Type B: max 10,000m2 or one day's production, whichever is the lesser
○ Type B material placed within 400mm of top of Type B level: min. 99%
○ Type B material placed more than 400mm of top of Type B level: min. 97%
Frequency - 1 test for each lot then reduced to 1 test for every second lot
Acceptance Criteria - Type B: initial 1 lot test to determine assigned CBR and swell
Frequency - Single CBR test to confirm assigned CBR and swell per every 8 lots
Acceptance Criteria - Type B: liquid limit and comparison of PI against LL
Frequency - 1 test per 2 lots then reduced to 1 test per 4 lots
Acceptance Criteria - SMWS to be written for each activity on Project and shall be reviewed by a competent person.
Submitted to the client
Resource Id: days prior to commencement of Activity.

Name: Acceptance Criteria - DBYD information available on site, Permit to work- Services issued with assest protection Plan. All services identified located proved and protected. Spotter at location before commencement of excavation works (If required)
Acceptance Criteria - No work shall commence unless all erosion/ Sediment controls are implemented in accordance with EMP.
Acceptance Criteria - Prior to commencement of excavation for the pipes the Contractor shall confirm the position of all pipes with the Superintendent after survey pegs have been installed
Acceptance Criteria - Pipe culverts – the width of the trench at and below the level of the top of the pipe shall have a horizontal clearance of 300 – 600mm
○ The base of the trench shall be compacted
○ Soft, wet or unusable material at the base of the pipes should be treated or replaced
Acceptance Criteria - Depth of the layer of Compacted bedding material shall be:
○ 100mm where pipe diameter is less than 1500mm
○ 200mm where pipe diameter is greater than 1500mm

○ Pipes – Rebate and socket ends of pipe shall be placed facing upstream. The lower portion of the pipe shall be in contact with the bedding for the full length of the section. (Pipes are free of cracks/ damage )

○ Joint shall be mortar jointed, or wrapped with a 200mm wide external joint rubber band.Rubber band thickness shall not be less than 2mm. In case of internally jointed pipes 600 mm diameter and larger, the mortar shall be struck off flush with the bore of the pipe.
○ Rubber ring joint pipes shall be jointed with rubber rings. Rubber rings shall be undisturbed clean and free from dirt.
○ Selected backfill material shall be placed for the full width of the bedding material to a height of 0.3m above the top of the culvert or subgrade level (whichever is lower)
Acceptance Criteria - SMWS to be written for each activity on Project and shall be reviewed by a competent person.
Submitted to the client
Resource Id: days prior to commencement of Activity.
